sections.heading: What the Scanner is for
body: The Scanner screen lets you scan Flovers QR codes that were generated earlier for your plants.
A typical workflow is to print the QR code and attach it to the plant pot, so you can quickly open the correct plant in the app later.
QR scanning is designed for convenience and fast navigation—no manual searching is needed.

sections.heading: Camera access requirement
body: To use the QR Scanner, the Flovers app requires permission to access your device’s camera.
The camera is used only to scan QR codes in real time and is not used for recording video or taking photos outside the scanning process.
If camera permission is denied, the Scanner feature will not work until access is granted in the system settings of your device.

sections.heading: What a Flovers QR code contains
body: A Flovers QR code contains a reference to Flovers and the ID of a specific Plant Instance in your account.
After the code is scanned and recognized correctly, the app performs a redirect to the corresponding plant.
The QR code is intended to work with your own plants stored in your account.

sections.heading: What happens after a successful scan
body: After a successful scan in the Scanner screen, the app redirects you to Plant Details.
In Plant Details you can view the plant’s information, assigned tasks, and the latest sensor readings (if a device is linked).
This makes the Scanner a quick entry point to everything related to a specific plant.

sections.heading: Where to preview the QR code for a plant
body: You can preview a plant’s QR code from the Plants list by opening the plant’s context menu (dropdown) and selecting the QR code option.
You can also view the QR code directly in Plant Details.
Both views provide quick access to the same QR code for the selected plant.

sections.heading: Saving or sending the QR code
body: From both the Plants list and Plant Details, you can save the QR code to your phone.
You can also send the QR code to your e-mail address, for example to print it later or store it as a backup.
If you print QR codes, make sure they remain readable (good contrast, no wrinkles, no glare).

sections.heading: Troubleshooting scan issues
body: If a scan fails, try improving lighting and keeping the code flat and fully visible in the camera frame.
If the QR code is damaged or blurred, re-save or re-send it from the app and print a new copy.
If the code opens the wrong plant, verify that you selected the correct plant when generating or exporting the QR code.
